Subjective: Complaints of irritation in the right eye since Tuesday morning.
Patient feels like there is something in the right eye.
Patient has no pain in the eye.
Since yesterday, there is also redness in the other eye.
Patient does not wear contact lenses.
Patient has no sensitivity to light.
Patient asks whether the symptoms are consistent with normal eye inflammation.
Patient asks whether antibiotic eye drops are necessary.
Objective: The right eye is redder than the left eye.
The right eye is more swollen than the left eye.
There is no foreign body visible in the eye.
Both pupils respond normally to light.
Assessment: The image best fits viral conjunctivitis.
Plan: Patient advised not to rub their eyes.
Use of artificial tears recommended for relief.
Rinsing the eyes with lukewarm water recommended in case of irritation.
Patient instructed to contact again if symptoms persist for more than 2 weeks.
Patient instructed to contact again if pain increases.
Patient instructed to contact again if pus production increases.
The patient has been instructed to contact us again if their eyes become stuck shut.
The patient has been instructed to contact us again if their vision deteriorates.
